thread.section_title: ESPN FC - English Premier League News
thread.title: Trending: Arsenal reject Tuchel talk, Messi scores 40 goals again
thread.title_full: Trending: Arsenal reject Tuchel talk, Messi scores 40 goals again

author: ESPN staff
title: Trending: Arsenal reject Tuchel talk, Messi scores 40 goals again
text:
less than a minute ago Trending: Arsenal reject Tuchel talk, Messi scores 40 goals again Gab Marcotti provides an update on Arsene Wenger after the manager said he's made a decision about his Arsenal future. 
ARSENAL : Arsenal have denied reports by German newspaper Bild that they have approached Borussia Dortmund boss Thomas Tuchel to replace Arsene Wenger. 
- Wenger says Champions League qualification has not influenced his decision on his future, amid reports that he would like to stay on as Arsenal manager. 
BARCELONA : Luis Enrique heaped yet more praise on Lionel Messi after the Argentine's brace in Barcelona's 4-2 win over Valencia on Sunday took him past 40 goals for the eighth consecutive season. 
MAN CITY : Pep Guardiola claimed it was "one of happiest days of my career as a manager" after Manchester City's 1-1 draw with Liverpool. 
LIVERPOOL : Jurgen Klopp refused to get carried away by Liverpool's performance in the 1-1 draw at Manchester City on Sunday but declared the result a "success." 
- Liverpool's James Milner now holds the record for the most Premier League games unbeaten when he has been on the scoresheet. 
- Rudy Gestede has said there was no bite from him or Eric Bailly during a clash towards the end of Manchester United's win. 
CHELSEA : Antonio Conte joked that he might consider playing Gary Cahill as a striker after the England international netted a vital late goal in Chelsea's 2-1 win over Stoke City to preserve the Blues' 10-point lead at the top of the Premier League. 
- Chelsea midfielder N'Golo Kante doesn't feel like the best player in the Premier League, despite calls for the former Leicester man to be named the league's top player for this season. 
REAL MADRID : Real Madrid coach Zinedine Zidane hailed his team's "personality" in getting a "very important" three points in the title race by beating Athletic Bilbao 2-1 away on Saturday afternoon. 
ATLETICO MADRID : Atletico Madrid right-back Sime Vrsaljko is likely to face a long spell on the sidelines after sustaining a serious knee injury in their 3-1 home win over Sevilla on Sunday. 
BAYERN MUNICH : Thomas Muller said he was "a happy man" after scoring only his second Bundesliga goal of the season as Bayern Munich moved 13 points clear at the top with a 1-0 win at Borussia Monchengladbach. 
LIGUE 1 : Kylien Mbappe signed off on a memorable week in style with two goals in Ligue 1 leaders Monaco's 3-0 win at Caen. 
- Adrien Rabiot has insisted Paris Saint-Germain are determined to bounce back from their Champions League capitulation to Barcelona. 
ENGLAND : West Ham winger Michail Antonio has withdraw n from the England squad for the games against Germany and Lithuania due to a hamstring injury. 
MLS : The New York Red Bulls' unbeaten streak ended one game short of matching the MLS record as they lost 3-1 at the Seattle Sounders on Monday. 
UNITED STATES : U.S. Soccer has removed injured striker Bobby Wood from its squad for a key set of World Cup qualifiers and added midfielder Sacha Kljestan and defender Matt Besler. 
Follow @ESPNFC on Twitter to keep up with the latest football updates.
